embeds.title: Cheat
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Play one of the top 3 (5) cards in your draw pile.
**Dead On:** Also trigger its **Dead On** effect.

messages.content: wth they made a good hermit card
you can do crazy stuff with this like messing with maintenance
but it's also "just good"
what if havoc was viable
actually insane
Cheat adapt decks my beloved
The one thing I don't like about this card, is how if you draw multiple the second one is usually unplayable
So you can only really play 1 copy

you know, I kinda rarely have this in my decks, I usually run a lot of low cost cards on Hermit or a curse build, this doesn´t mesh well with the kinda of decks I build, if have good high cost cards I´ll consider this more highly
But its almost never bad
It´s kinda bad in a curse build or a deck with few 2+ cost cards
As far as low cost cards go this does cast enervate:)
You could have just drawn an enervate
instead of cheat
I think the thing with casting cheap cards is like

If you cast deadeye with it its the same as those
If you cast ghostly presence/body armor its also the same as those, if you cast hole up it is worse
But ghostly presence will never give you strength and deadeye will never give the enemy weak. A split GP/deadeye card would be really really good for example. It does suffer from consistency loss if unupgraded though, especially in fights like taskmaster

if most of your cards are not curses and not 0 cost, this is almost never a bad card to draw or to play. At least the first one per turn. It's 3(5) chances at getting whatever effect you really need this turn instead of 1, and 3(5) chances of cheating something that costs more than 1 energy.

It´s a good card but I can´t help but feel kinda disappointed by It sometimes, because of It´s variance, I want to play It early and play out the rest of my turn accordingly, but the dead on effect says otherwise
In curse decks It´s pretty bad and antithetical to what the deck is trying to do, curses decks want to cycle fast, and this sees too many curses when the deck starts to reach critical mass of curses
It kinda begs for an upgrade for consistency, though Hermit is already really hungry for upgrades in general
Yeah its not a curses deck card
You do sometimes find a final canter and win even though you paid an extra mana for it but id rather not have it in curses
It´s kinda bad for the card to not do well in what I find is the most consistent archetype Hermit has
maybe I like this card because I never do the curses archetype
I think I havent ever built the curses deck past A10
Most of my decks are either "pick every no holds barred you see and try to pretend you're playing watcher", deadeye scaling, or determination piles
Oh or magnum pyramid
as for the dead on thing, the trick is that you don't have to care about that unless your deck is dead-on centric. It just passes on the center-of-hand status to whatever card it plays
Yeah the dead on is whatever
You probably want to trigger it but a lot of the time you dont care unlike deadeye/ghostly presence/snapshot which are useless without dead on
it's a nice bonus, and it lets you cheat out <roughhouse> for the full effect, but that's it

embeds.title: THATS RIGHT WE'RE GONNA CHEAT

messages.content: I guess if you're looking for cards this pairs badly with another example would be <lone wolf>

embeds.title: Lone Wolf
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Choose a card.
It costs 0 this turn.
Discard the rest of your hand.

messages.content: Honestly a really versatile card, just lets you play one of 3(5) cards in your draw pile. Even if you only play a 1 cost, it is a pseudo-draw kinda, can be used to set up some expensive dead on activations without actually being expensive
the one catch is that if you're using this as pseudo draw, it doesn't actually filter out your basics or curses--you'll still draw those next turn
It's also scry-adjacent in the fact that it tells you your draw order, so you know what to expect for next turn, or if you will get a lot if value from <luck of the draw>

embeds.title: Luck of the Draw
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Draw until you draw 3 (4) total :energy_hermit:  worth of cards.

messages.content: overall it actually synergizes with LotD very well, since playing a high cost card is already efficient, it also means you get more draw.
This just seems like a card with very little downside, the biggest one being that it is considered two card plays, and hermit fights heart and time eater
However, unlike most "little downside" cards it has an important and valuable upside to it.

I think it is an above average card, and I think balance wise it is just right, as what it does is mostly letting you get to your good cards faster/more consistently, with a little bit of energy cheating mixed in.
I've seen this video a lot, and it never gets old
It's a classic
I'm still not sure if lone wolf is a good card
if you draw them together
After winning an a20 run
in my experience, the better cheat is, the worse LotD is
and vice versa
Yeah
That seems about right
Lotd is kinda meh in most decks just because you dont have a lot of energy production
Even if you have a lot of cheap cards
I think

I'm very split on lone wolf too. It has its purpose (mostly for abusing <combo type=power>) but otherwise I haven't found much value in it. It feels similar to cheat but for a card in hand instead of in the draw pile, but losing the ability to play any other card is rough.

embeds.title: Combo
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Put the first  (2) **Dead On** card (cards) triggered each turn back into your hand.

messages.content: I´d say It´s about average, though It might be my playstyle leaning towards curse decks and low cost decks

Outside of curse decks I can't really think of any that wouldn't want it. In my experience even with low cost decks it's still fine, as it lets you get to your LotD faster, although it definitely isn't a priority pickup.
And I stray far from curses, occasionally I dabble with <final canter>, get disappointed, wait a few months and repeat the cycle

embeds.title: Final Canter
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Retain**.
**Exhaust** all **Curse**s in hand. Deal 10 (13) damage for each. **Exhaust**.

messages.content: Curses are either like the most broken deck you've ever played in STS or absolutely unplayable shit that doesnt let you even beat the first boss or second hallways
Final canter isn't really *the* curses card, tho
Sometimes I play final canter in offbrand decks just to randomly cast backstab
although if you consider <fatal desire> a curse card then sure, I use curses regularly. I use it mostly for the draw.

embeds.title: Fatal Desire
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
At the start of your turn, draw 2 cards and add an Injury to your hand.

messages.content: Fatal desire is possibly the best incremental card draw in the entire game
Or close to it
But to me, getting fatal desire for curse generation is like buying pencils so you can use the erasers.
Yeah
Use the damn lead, it's so much better.
And if you really care enough, buy an eraser.
(I don't count things like overclock or combo-rushdown cause theyre doing different things)
<overclock>??

Draw 3 cards.

messages.content: It´s not a curse deck if It doesn´t abuse shadow cloak
Yeah thats definitely in the competition

fatal desire is great in any deck and broken in curse builds
Does this count as a curse deck in your eyes
yes, since It´s main way to scale block is shadow cloak
The main way to scale block of this deck is hole up
hole up doesn´t scale though
However the main way to scale power is doubts
Well thats the second main way
I think the point is you don't have to scale blocks that much when you can output 30+ block for basically free

A very powerful effect here, letting you pick whatever the most relevant of the 3 (5) cards is and playing it, while also potentially cheating on its energy cost. Do note that this is not all upside, as cheat is a skill, and both cards are played, which is relevant against time eater, the heart, chosen, gremlin nob, and with velvet choker. It also has some issues with planning out your turn when you have adapt active as well as other sequencing issues. Since you’re not sure what cheat will actually do for you this turn, you have less information available as to what you should be exhausting with adapt. You will usually want to play cheat early in your turn, to know what it’s providing for you, to avoid over blocking or other inefficient uses of energy. Trying to do that can cause issues with dead-on for other cards, if for example, cheat is drawn on the far left of your hand, and a dead-on card is in the 2nd position.

With all that being said, I don’t want to discourage you from this card too much. Most of the time, once you’re into act 2, you know what boss relic you have, and you’ve passed through some of the more challenging fights for cheat. Getting to pick the best of 3 (5) cards is a very strong effect, and can be extremely useful for getting down key powers and scaling cards quickly. It’s just such a useful way to find the right card for the right turn, and handle what the enemy’s current intent is. Do note that the other 2 (4) cards stay where they are, which can also be quite useful to know what you will draw if you were to play something like quickdraw or vantage, or to know what you will draw next turn, which can be very relevant when deciding which cards to keep in your hand from coalescence.

You can use cheat to repeatedly play the cost increase cards (maintenance, desperado, heroic bravado) even once they get too expensive. Cheat often gets better as the run goes on, as you have more opportunities to add expensive, scaling, and niche cards to your deck that it can dig to and discount. The dead-on component is fairly deck dependent, but it’s a nice upside that it can trigger the dead-on effects of other cards, and it does count twice for smoking barrel. The upgrade is very good, since it increases the consistency of cheat, letting you find the right card for the turn and/or get a significant discount more often. Frozen eye can be very powerful with this card if you have some card draw as well to cheat out high cost cards more frequently.
true!
